shoulder_rotation_angle.description: Maximum shoulder rotation during backswing. Greater rotation stores more energy for powerful smash.

shoulder_angular_velocity.description: Peak rotational speed of shoulders. Elite players achieve 700-1000 deg/s.

elbow_extension_angle.description: Elbow angle at contact. Near-full extension (160-175°) maximizes reach and power.

elbow_angular_velocity.description: Speed of elbow extension. Critical for generating racket head speed.

wrist_snap_timing.description: Wrist peak velocity timing relative to elbow. Should occur 5-12% after elbow peak.

hip_shoulder_separation.description: Rotational coil between hips and shoulders. Greater separation = more stored energy.

knee_flexion_angle.description: Knee bend during loading. Optimal 110-130° balances power and stability.

com_vertical_displacement.description: Upward body movement during swing. Jump smash shows significant displacement.

hip_shoulder_delay.description: Time between hip and shoulder peak velocity. Proper sequencing: 20-35ms.

shoulder_elbow_delay.description: Time between shoulder and elbow peak. Optimal range: 15-30ms.

elbow_wrist_delay.description: Time between elbow and wrist peak. Should be 10-20ms for proper snap.

swing_duration_ms.description: Total swing time from loading to contact. Elite range: 200-300ms.
